page.title: 09THE HARBOUR
page.content:
During 1985 the outer harbour was deepened and some of the walls refaced, so that boats might use the harbour even closer to low water. The E.E.C. helped provide the money for this. The boats still put to sea at half tide on the ebb, and return at half-tide on the flood tide.
{SALMON FISHING.} Nets are erected just outside the harbour and to the south. The catches this year have been very poor.
{NETMAKING.} A net repairing business works from a building above the harbour making and repairing nets for the larger deep sea boats.
{FISHERMEN.} There are people who work on boats based in Wick & Scrabster.
